meanings.definition: The act of traveling from place to place.
meanings.sent1: Her itinerancy took her to many different countries.
meanings.sent2: The explorer's itinerancy led him to discover new lands.
meanings.sent3: The itinerancy of the circus performers kept the audience entertained.
meanings.sent4: The itinerancy of the migrating birds amazed the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The itinerancy of the nomadic tribe was a way of life.

meanings.definition: The state of being constantly on the move.
meanings.sent1: The itinerancy of the ants in the garden fascinated the children.
meanings.sent2: The itinerancy of the busy city never seemed to slow down.
meanings.sent3: The itinerancy of the wind made the trees sway back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The itinerancy of thoughts in his mind kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The itinerancy of the river never ceased to flow.

meanings.definition: The practice of traveling regularly for work or leisure.
meanings.sent1: His itinerancy for business meetings made him a seasoned traveler.
meanings.sent2: The itinerancy of the vacationers brought life to the resort town.
meanings.sent3: The itinerancy of the food critic allowed him to taste dishes from around the world.
meanings.sent4: The itinerancy of the salesperson helped expand the company's reach.
meanings.sent5: The itinerancy of the artist inspired her creative works.
